content:
Great choices! Goodreads is an excellent tool for tracking progress and discovering new books. And audiobooks are a fantastic way to make the most of your commute time! You're making great use of your daily commute to fit in some reading.

I'm glad to hear you enjoyed "The Hating Game" - it's such a fun and engaging read. And now you're onto "Gone Girl", which is a completely different genre, but just as gripping! Gillian Flynn's writing is masterful, and the twists and turns in "Gone Girl" will keep you on the edge of your seat.

How are you finding the transition from a rom-com like "The Hating Game" to a psychological thriller like "Gone Girl"? Are you enjoying the change of pace, or do you find yourself missing the lightheartedness of "The Hating Game"?

Also, have you noticed any differences in your listening experience between the two books? For example, are you finding that the narrator's style or pace affects your engagement with the story?
